meanings.sent1: The wizard was omnipotent and could make anything happen with a wave of his wand.
meanings.sent2: The king believed he was omnipotent and could control everything in his kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The omnipotent superhero could lift buildings effortlessly, much to the amazement of the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her omnipotent influence over the group was evident as they all followed her lead without question.
meanings.sent5: The storm raged with an omnipotent force, tearing through the town without mercy.

meanings.sent1: In the fairy tale, the omnipotent sorcerer could defeat any enemy with a single spell.
meanings.sent2: The ancient deity was believed to be omnipotent, capable of creating and destroying worlds.
meanings.sent3: The omnipotent cat ruled the neighborhood, demanding treats and attention from everyone.
meanings.sent4: His omnipotent presence in the boardroom made all the employees nervous, knowing he held their fate in his hands.
meanings.sent5: The sun's omnipotent rays warmed the earth, bringing life to all living creatures.

meanings.sent1: With his omnipotent abilities, the magician could make objects disappear and reappear at will.
meanings.sent2: The genie in the lamp was omnipotent, granting any wish that was asked of it.
meanings.sent3: The omnipotent chef could turn basic ingredients into gourmet dishes with a flick of his wrist.
meanings.sent4: Her omnipotent knowledge of the subject made her the go-to person for any questions or problems.
meanings.sent5: The artist's omnipotent creativity knew no bounds, leading to masterpieces that captivated all who saw them.
